Besides standard doctoral networks, incentives have been introduced to promote two specific types of doctorates as well:

- Industrial doctorates: they train PhD candidates who wish to develop their skills and step outside academia
- Joint doctorates: they provide a highly integrated type of international, inter-sectoral, and interdisciplinary collaboration
column6: For businesses and scientists who are interested in each other's capabilities and ideas. Budget depends on competitiveness of the project and capabilities of investors

column5: Future Ukraine is a new DAAD programme to support Ukrainian universities and allow young scientists to participate in Ukraine's recovery. Thanks to the programme, you can work on research in Germany for half a year without worrying about money‚Äîthe monthly stipend will cover living expenses. You will also receive round-trip travel and insurance.

column1: ERC. Consolidator & Proof of Concept Grants
column5:
Annual ERC work program under the specific program implementing Horizon Europe. Scientific excellence is the sole criterion on the basis of which ERC grants are awarded. Applications for European Research Council can be made in any field of research

Look for other grants also if interested
column6: Researchers of any nationality with 2+/7+ years of experience since obtaining a PhD, a research record with promise. Lump sum of ‚Ç¨150,000 for 18 months (Proof of Concept) & ‚Ç¨2 million for 5 years (Consolidator)

column5:
The Institute for Human Sciences invites applications. In recognition of Giedroyc‚Äôs legacy as founding editor of Kultura, and his promoting wider understanding of history and traditions of modern-day Poland, Belarus, Lithuania, Ukraine, these fellowships are designated for such projects:
- Polish-Ukrainian, Polish-Belarusian, Polish-Lithuanian relations / related questions of history, politics, literature
- The legacy of Giedroyc particularly, and/or the journal and publishing house Kultura
column6: Candidates must be enrolled in a doctoral program in the humanities or social sciences or have obtained a PhD in the same fields no longer than 4 years ago. A stipend of ‚Ç¨2,750 or 3,300 per month (depending on type)

column1: Ukraine in European Dialogue Junior Fellowship
column5: Program aims to support the research of Ukrainian scholars who are completing or have recently completed their doctoral studies. It offers access to the resources of the Institute for Human Sciences in Vienna to younger researchers who have demonstrated exceptional talent to allow them to work on a research project of their own choice. Fellowships are open to academic disciplines in the humanities, social sciences. Research proposals related to the mission and research of the IWM are encouraged.
column6: For Ukrainian citizens, enrolled in a doctoral program in the humanities or social sciences or have obtained a PhD in the same fields in the past 4 years. A stipend of ‚Ç¨2,750 or 3,300 per month (depending on type)
